fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37054].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce


- Go to confluence and delete your jira acess token http://confluence/users/revokeoauthtokens.action
- Create a new confluence page with a colon ( : ) on its name. Page url should be something like http://confluence/something/yourpagewithcolon:intherurl
- In a test issue try to link that recently created confluence  page.
- It'll ask you to do the login dance. Do it
- Click on link button
- [ BUG ] It'll prompt again to do the login dance. No matter how many times you do the dance, it won't accept the link. And it will create as much tokens for the jira instance on confluence as tries to do the dance.

*Note that this only ocurrs with that particular url I've tried a clean url one https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~scia/test and it works fine.*

h2. Workaround

- On the confluence page you want to link go to Tools/Page History
- Click on CURRENT version link
- Use that url to link to the issue. (Should be something similar to _yoursite.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=number_)
fields.summary: Confluence pages containing a colon cannot be linked to an issue if you need to do login dance first.

fields.description:
After successfully logging in via the dashboard gadget, the {{JSESSIONID}} cookie is set with its Path set to the tomcat context path + "/". Contrast this to the {{atlassian.xsrf.token}} cookie Path which is set to just the context path (no trailing slash).

After successful login, Chrome redirects to the root of the JIRA installation. Since the root path lacks the trailing slash, the {{JSESSIONID}} cookie is not sent (only the {{atlassian.xsrf.token}} cookie is sent), which results in JIRA responding with a new, "lout" session ID cookie and displaying the login gadget on the dashboard.

Logging in via the {{/index.jsp}} path works as expected.

Tested using Chromium 32.0.1700.102.
JIRA context path set to {{/jira}}.
fields.summary: JSESSIONID cookie path breaks login via gadget in Chrome

fields.description:
According to http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/index.html?java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html you are allowed to use a single y letter to represent years in a date. 
If you are using a format where the Year is represented by a single "y" in the  *Complete Date/Time Format* setting ({{Administration >> System >> Look And Feel}}), such as:
# dd.MM.y HH:mm

The year is not parsed correctly and will show as *06.02.Y 23:30*.
This seems to happen only for *Complete Date/Time Format*, and does not affect *Day/Month/Year Format*. 

The date is actually parsed correctly in the Date/Time format configuration page like so: [^CompleteDateTimeFormat.jpg]
But when viewing a JIRA issue, you get: [^Y.jpg]

Also tested on 6.2 m7.

WORKAROUND:
# Set the format to use "yyyy" instead.
fields.summary: Using a single "y" in Complete Date/Time Format breaks the date display

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37024].
  {panel}

Hi,

some month ago we switched from Mantis to JIRA. One of the features we're really missing is a background-color for columns - depending on the status the ticket actually has.

Our current workaround is the script from http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/134394

I attached a screenshot how it looks like when I view all my tickets, ordered by status ASC, updated DESC.

You can see at first sight that it's much clearer what kind of tickets are open, what status they have and how many there actually are for each status. This color also affects the ticket detail page, where the status column is still colored.

It's fine for me with the script, but it is not for our customers. They don't know about the script, they don't know how to install a script, they don't want a script and - of course and most important - they shoudn't need a script.

Maybe it's possible for you to implement the userscript (see link above) as a standard tool. That would be really great.

As this setting could be optional, none of the current JIRA users would have any disadvantage.

Thank you!

Regards,
Martin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37023].
  {panel}

Let's say you have some security levels set for a particular project, and in some levels there is a *Current Assignee* permission. 

If a user has the permission to create issues in a project, that user is able to select *any* issue security level which has the Current Assignee permission, even if the user can't be assigned due to other permissions.
This holds in the following scenarios:
# The user is NOT an Assignable User.
# The user is NOT the default assignee as per the project config.

The user then ends up creating an issue which he/she cannot see due to the other permissions as per above.

There should be a check for Assignable User before allowing the user to see and select those security levels.
fields.summary: Current Assignee on a security level allows a user creating issues to select these security levels even if that user cannot be assigned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37004].
  {panel}

This is based on feedback from a customer:

Is there a better way to handle many of the different Errors and NPEs that JIRA users may encounter (resulting from special cases of invalid Issue Field data/ database inconsistency) when trying to access JIRA issues, projects etc., such that instead of just throwing a stacktrace without any other useful content, that some of the available requested data is displayed wherever possible and wherever it is valid to do so, and a compact error message about the data inconsistency is shown on the interface?

For instance, an NPE is thrown due to an invalid workflow status when trying to access an issue. Instead of not being able to view the issue data at all. Is it possible to still render the valid aspects of the issue/project data and then just show a warning error that alerts the user to the database corruption? And then prevent changes that may make the invalid data cause additional problems. Also, the full stack trace can still be hidden in a expansible panel as is already obtainable in JIRA.

Implementing this perhaps may introduce more resource implications, levels of complexity and perhaps other unpredictable behaviour in the programming logic, and I mentioned this to our customer who raised it. However, I'd leave it to developers to determine what level of improvement can be made to handling issue rendering under these special circumstances.
fields.summary: Improve Error/Exception handling, such that it's still possible to view issues even when some field data is broken

Loading administration page for project with a large number of issue type will hit the "Down for maintenance" screen.
It is suspected to be HTTP request timing out.

It's a risk for all Projects that use the Default Issue Type Scheme, as it includes all Issue Types in the JIRA instance and could gradually grow to a level that will result in timeout errors.

create smaller Issue Type Schemes for specific Projects.

fields.description:
In our plugin [RemindMe|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.communardo.jira.plugins.remindme] we have a dialog which should open in InlineDialogMode using the CSS class _trigger-dialog_, as described in [this tutorial|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Displaying+Content+in+a+Dialog+in+JIRA#DisplayingContentinaDialoginJIRA-Step6.CreatingtheSimplestofDialogs].

This does not work with JIRA 6.2-rc1 anymore.

Looking at the sources of 6.2-rc1,  this is due to a change in {{/jira-project/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/webapp/includes/jira/dialog/initDialogs.js}} where the onclick-handler for {{a.trigger-dialog}} is defined. In this handler {{JIRA.FormDialog}} is created -- upto 6.2-m07 -- with {{ajaxOptions.data.inline}} set to {{true}}. But starting with 6.2-beta1 this value is set to {{false}}, which in turn sets the field {{inline}} in the Java class {{JiraWebActionSupport}} to {{false}}, which in turn prevents us from detecting InlineDialogMode in our Velocity-template with {{#if ($action.isInlineDialogMode())}}.

In my opinion, this is a bug. Or is there now another way to detect InlineDialogMode in JIRA 6.2?
fields.summary: Using the CSS class "trigger-dialog" does not correctly open links in InlineDialogMode anymore

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.1.x, it appears no longer possible to configure an application link whose public 'display' URL (eg. "https://jira.company.com") is different from its internal 'application' URL (eg. "http://jira.localhost"). The base URL is used for both. This is a regression from 6.0.x, where it was possible.

h3. Workaround
The current workaround is to set the BaseURL of the applications to the URL you want to create the link with, then create the link. The Application URL for both applications will be their BaseURL. You can then set the BaseURL back to the correct user-facing URL, and edit the Display URL of the application link.
This behaviour is present in Applinks 4.0. You can see the versions of our software that contain Applinks 4.0 [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Application+Links+Version+Matrix].

h3. JIRA 6.0.x applink workflow

Here's how it used to work in 6.0 and earlier (screenshots from the [Adding an Application Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Adding+an+Application+Link] docs, which haven't been updated).

First specify the application URL - ie. the _internal_ URL (notice the non-standard port):
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/222724578/UAL-AddAppLink-LinkURL.png?api=v2!

In the next step, one could set the reciprocal application URL (as the docs say, "override the base URL specified in your remote application"):

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/222724578/UAL-AddAppLink-LinkBack.png?api=v2!

Finally, if the application URL != display URL, one could edit the applink, and set its Display URL explicitly:

!configureapplink.png!

h3. JIRA 6.1.x applink workflow

Say we're in https://jira.mycompany.com, wishing to create an applink to http://confluence.localhost, with display URL https://confluence.mycompany.com. We fill in the URL:

!jira615_applink1.png!

and.. 

!jira615_applink2.png!

JIRA has ignored the URL you entered ({{http://confluence.localhost}} ) and instead used the base URL. There is no opportunity to override this. Nor can this be first by editing the applink afterwards, as the application URL is unchangeable:

!jira615_applink3.png!
fields.summary: Unable to specify different application link and display link

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

Create a User Directory with a User/Group filter larger than 255 chars.
h3. Expected Results:

JIRA should give an error on the same screen explaining the value is too big
h3. Actual Results:

JIRA throws a "We had some technical problems during your last operation.
 We deeply apologize for that :(" error page with the response from the database
{code:java}
Request processing failed; nested exception is com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:DirectoryAttribute][directoryId,10001][name,ldap.user.filter][value,(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*)(|(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)(memberof=cn=lerolero,dc=lero,dc=com)))] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)))
{code}
h3. Workaround

*Note:* Before trying these steps, it is very important to both create a backup of your SQL data as well as to then stop Jira before trying these steps. Take a note of the configuration as well as there are multiple cases that have reported that the configuration will be missing after increase the column size.

It is currently possible to work-around this issue by following the steps in the KB [Data truncation due to data too long for column - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/data-truncation-due-to-data-too-long-for-column-277253600.html].
 # Create a backup of your SQL data in Jira.  [Backing up data - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/backing-up-data-802592964.html] has details on how to do this, but Atlassian recommends using the native database backup tools for this instead of relying upon the XML backup.
 # Stop Jira
 # You can then run the following SQL commands against the database to change these column sizes (this syntax is correct for postgresql, other versions of SQL might have a different syntax)
{code:sql}
alter table cwd_directory_attribute alter column attribute_value type varchar (400);{code}
Note: this example expands the column to accept 400 characters in this case.  You might need a larger value here should your filter be still greater than this.
 # Start Jira
fields.summary: User/group Directory filter throws a 'value too long' error when exceeding 255 characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36973].
  {panel}

Hello JIRA team,

I would like to propose an enhancement for JIRA that will IMO benefit all agile/lean teams out there. 

=========
Narrative
=========

AS a team member

I WANT jira to stop me from going above my defined WIP limit

SO that I can stop starting and start finalizing

================================================
Scenarios (examples based on classes of services aka CoS)
================================================

GIVEN an attempt to assign an issue to a user

WHEN the issue is expedite and there is one current expedite issue assigned

THEN do not accept the assignment

WHEN the issue is non expedite (fixed delivery date, standard or intangible) and there are two current non expedite issues assigned

THEN do not accept the assignment

==========================================================
Implementation proposal (applicable to any kind of scenarios including the above)
==========================================================

Note how the two WHEN can be expressed as a JQL filter, an operator and a result count. Let us call them Personal WIP rules:

filter, operator, count

PWIP rule1: CoS = "expedite", <=, 1

PWIP rule2: CoS in ("fixed delivery date", "standard", "intangible"), <=, 2

These rules should be assigned to user roles.

Suppose some user (the originator) attempts to assign a candidate issue to another user or self (the target). The system will count the current tickets assigned based on the filter rules for the target user, will apply the filter rules for the candidate issue and if a filter condition is matched then the count will increase for that filter. The rules will trigger and only if the user can accept the ticket the operation will be successful.

In fact the target user should not even be presented as a candidate to resolve the ticket. At a minimum, as stated above, the validation of the submission should fail. The result should be an error like "Could not perform this action. Personal WIP limit reached"

Thanks!

- Nestor
fields.summary: Setting Personal WIP or WIP limits per user

# Core Connector 1.4.5 - https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=446136939
# JIRA Connector 1.4.5 - https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=446136929

This bundle is a bug fix for Multi Remote Onject Link as reported in this thread: http://community.servicerocket.com/servicerocket/topics/customers_using_the_salesforce_connector_with_a_multi_remote_object_link_custom_field_are_unable_to_create_issues

The list workflows scheme page lists all the workflow schemes + an inline representation of each scheme. This means the size of the page can blow out if there are workflows schemes with a lot of issues types associated. In this example data there are 551 workflow schemes with 63801 explicit mappings that need to display on that page.

2) The event I'm using to trigger notifications is Issue Resolved. And I'm sending to a group.
3) I've attached my Notification Scheme to a project that is using Simplified Workflow.
4) We're using JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
We are having trouble attaching files to issues/tickets.  I've attached a screen capture displaying the error message.  Whenever we attempt to attache a file, we get the error:
Cannot attach file newBadge.png: Exception trying to establish attachment directory. Check that the application server and JIRA have permissions to write to it: com.atlassian.jira.web.util.AttachmentException: Cannot write to attachment directory. Check that the application server and JIRA have permissions to write to: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/ED/ED-2272

The file size is not a factor, big and small images of different formats get the same error.

How to reproduce the error:
1) We open an issue/ticket
2) In the "More" drop-down menu, we select "Attach Files"
3) In the popup window to attache the file, we select the file we want and we get the error message listed above. 

Thanks for looking into this.
-Alex
fields.summary: Cannot attach files to issues/tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36951].
  {panel}

We have a corporate account (EDUCAUSE JIRA) and we purchased the additional UI Mockup service.  We can make mockups, but cannot attach the mockups to tickets via the save mechanism.  Attached is a screenshot of the error message, shown in the black box, bottom left.

How to replicate the problem:
1) We open an issue/ticket.
2) In the "More" drop-down list, we select "Add/Edit UI Mockup"
3) Create a mockup, does not matter if it is simple or complex.
4) Click the "Save" button in the Mockup menu bar

Thanks for looking into this.
-Alex
fields.summary: Balsamiq UI mockup will not save

fields.description:
JIRA does not allow to search in Reporter field for disabled users. For example, I need to find a tickets written by a user that is not working in our company for now. I can't enter his name in Reporter field in simple search mode, even I know his "shortname" (login).

For example (real):
Username is "ab" (without quotes), when I writing "ab" - I have no any users in popuped suggestions. When I trying to write his first name - the same (no suggestions). When I wrote "ab" and moved cursor from the field and tried to search - nothing.
fields.summary: JIRA does not allow to search in Reporter field for disabled users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36949].
  {panel}

If Email Type is HTML, no date is included in the content of the notification email (regardless of events):
!edithtml.png|thumbnail!

If Email Type is Text, date is included in the content of the notification email for *issuecommentedited* but not *issuecommented* or *issueupdated*:
!edittext.png|thumbnail!

!addtext.png|thumbnail!

!updatetext.png|thumbnail!

What's worth noticing is the included date has a different format as the one specified in Look and Feel:
!lookandfeel.png|thumbnail!

This causes confusion/inconvenience to customers. Though the templates can be edited but this practice is complex and unsupported. Customers prefer this date format to resemble the Look and Feel format or at least to be given an option for configuring it easily.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Date Notifications & Unconfigurable Date Format in Notification Emails
Renaming users should automatically edit existing JQL filters to reflect that new username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36946].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Custom Field
# Assigned it to all screens and only Improvement Issue Type .
# Create a Test Project.
# Create a Bug Ticket inside the Test Project.
# After it is created edit the ticket.
# Change the Issue Type but don't save it yet.

*Expected Result:*
The screen will be updated and the custom field will appear.

*Actual Result:*
The screen is not updated and the custom field is not appearing.

*Note:*
* The problem might that it still detect as Bug Issue Type when it edited
* For create issue screen, when it change the Issue Type it will have a loading icon and the screen updated
* If after changing the Issue Type and save it, then edit it again the custom field will appears.
fields.summary: Edit Screen not updated when Issue Type changed

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA Service Desk *1.2* and greater.
# Create a new Service Desk.
# Uninstall or disable it.

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA instance does not have any problems.

h3. Actual Results

Attempting to access the instance or search throws a NPE.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Execute the below SQL on the database:
{code:SQL}
DELETE FROM schemepermissions 
WHERE  perm_type = 'sd.customer.portal.only'; 
{code}
# Start JIRA.

With the workaround, the problem could occur again whenever Service Desk is uninstalled or disabled again. Hence the recommendation would be to upgrade JIRA to 6.2 or the latest version which has the bug fix and prevents this from happening.

If you wish to reinstall Service Desk, when new Service Desk is created it will repopulate that table.
fields.summary: JIRA search broken after disabling Service Desk
